Albert Einstein - Because he was one of the most influential scientists in history, his knowledge and insight into the universe could help us solve some of our current scientific challenges.
Mahatma Gandhi - Because of his philosophy of non-violence and peaceful protest, he could inspire people to come together and work towards positive change in society.
Martin Luther King Jr. - Because of his leadership in the civil rights movement, he could provide guidance on how to address issues of racial inequality and discrimination.

Marie Curie - Because she was a pioneer in the field of radioactivity and her discoveries had far-reaching implications for medicine and technology, she could offer insights into new areas of research.
Leonardo da Vinci - Because of his creativity and genius, he could share his ideas on art, science, and engineering, helping to push the boundaries of human achievement.
